0_TextBox_2:
Assistant	Professor	of	Radiology	
Brigham	and	Women’s	Hospital	
Harvard	Medical	School
3_TextBox_0:
Drag	and	drop	the	
slicer4minute.mrb	to	load	
the	scene	in	Slicer
4_TextBox_0:
Slicer	displays	the	elements	
of	the	slicer4minute	scene.	
The	scene	contains	an	MRI	
scan	and	3D	surface	models	
of	the	brain.
6_TextBox_1:
Click	on	the	pin	icon	on	the	top	left corner	of	the	red	slice	to	
display	the	slice	viewer	menu.
Click	on	the	eye	icon	to	display	the	axial	slice	in	the	3D	Viewer
7_TextBox_0:
Use	the	slider	of	the	red	viewer	to	
browse	through	the	axial	MR	slices.	
Slicer	simultaneously	displays	the	
axial	slice	in	the	3D	viewer
8_TextBox_0:
Select	the	Skin	model	and	lower	the	
its	opacity	using	the	Opacity	slider	
in	the	3D	Display	tab
8_TextBox_1:
The	skull_bone.vtk	model	
appears	through	the	skin.
9_TextBox_0:
Position the mouse in the 3D viewer, click on the left-mouse button to drag and rotate the model.
Click on the right mouse button to zoom in and out
10_TextBox_0:
Click	on	the	pin	icons	in	the	
top	left  corner	of	the	red	
and	green	viewer	to	display	
the	slice	viewer	menu	

Click	on	the	eye	icon	to	
display	the	axial	and	
coronal	slice	in	the	3D	
viewer
11_TextBox_0:
Turn	off	the	visibility	of	the	
skull	to	display	the	brain	
white	maPer	mode
12_TextBox_3:
Select	the	hemispheric_white	matter.vtk model

Check	Clipping	in	the	3D	Display	tab	

In	the	Clipping	Planes	tab,	select	the	option ‘Green	Slice	Clipping’	and	check	‘Negative'
